intro: Tetracera korthalsii var. subrotundata, commonly known as the broad-leaved tetracera, is a tropical plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves that are often tinged with reddish veins. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish flowers that are typically surrounded by colorful bracts. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in horticulture.
